Service.Name: WMS
Service.Title: enviroSDI Web Map Service
Service.Abstract: enviroSDI is the Spatial Data Infrastructure of the UNEP/DEWA/GRID-Europe (http://www.grid.unep.ch). A compliant implementation of WMS 1.1.1 plus most of the SLD 1.0 extension (dynamic styling).

Layer.Title: enviroSDI Web Map Service
Layer.Abstract: enviroSDI is the Spatial Data Infrastructure of the UNEP/DEWA/GRID-Europe (http://www.grid.unep.ch). A compliant implementation of WMS 1.1.1 plus most of the SLD 1.0 extension (dynamic styling).

Layer.Name: preview:cs_ecoexp
Layer.Title: Cyclones surges economical exposure
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes an estimation of the annual economical exposition to surges from tropical cyclones of Saffir-Simpson category 1. It is based on four sources: 1) A compilation of best tracks dataset from WMO Regional Specialised Meteorological Centres (RSMCs) and Tropical Cyclone Warning Centres (TCWCs). As well as personal communication with Dr. Varigonda Subrahmanyam, Dr. James Weyman, Kiichi Sasaki, Philippe CAROFF, Jim Davidson, Simon Mc Gree, Steve Ready, Peter Kreft, Henrike Brecht. 2) A GIS modeling based on an initial equation from Greg Holland, which was further modified to take into consideration the movement of the cyclones through time. 3) A Digital Elevation Model (SRTM) at 90 m of resolution. 4) A Global Domestic Product grid for the year 2007, provided by the World Bank. Unit is expected average annual GDP (2007 as the year of reference) exposed in (US $, year 2000 equivalent) . This product was designed by UNEP/GRID-Europe for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: GIS processing UNEP/GRID-Europe.

Style.Name: cs_ecoexp_style
Style.Title: Raster
Style.Abstract: A sample style for rasters, good for displaying imagery

Layer.Name: preview:cs_events
Layer.Title: Cyclones surges events
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes a compilation of estimated storm surges triggered by tropical cyclones 1975-2007. It is based on three sources: 1) A compilation of best tracks dataset from WMO Regional Specialised Meteorological Centres (RSMCs) and Tropical Cyclone Warning Centres (TCWCs). As well as personal communication with Dr. Varigonda Subrahmanyam, Dr. James Weyman, Kiichi Sasaki, Philippe CAROFF, Jim Davidson, Simon Mc Gree, Steve Ready, Peter Kreft, Henrike Brecht. 2) A GIS modeling based on an initial equation from Greg Holland, which was further modified to take into consideration the movement of the cyclones through time. 3) A Digital Elevation Model (SRTM). This product was designed by UNEP/GRID-Europe for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: Compilation and GIS processing UNEP/GRID-Europe.

Style.Name: cs_events_style
Style.Title: Cyclones surges events
Style.Abstract: Cyclones surges events from 1976 to 2006

Layer.Name: preview:cs_frequency
Layer.Title: Cyclones surges frequency
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes an estimate of surges triggered by tropical cyclone frequency of Saffir-Simpson category 1. It is based on three sources: 1) A compilation of best tracks dataset from WMO Regional Specialised Meteorological Centres (RSMCs) and Tropical Cyclone Warning Centres (TCWCs). As well as personal communication with Dr. Varigonda Subrahmanyam, Dr. James Weyman, Kiichi Sasaki, Philippe CAROFF, Jim Davidson, Simon Mc Gree, Steve Ready, Peter Kreft, Henrike Brecht. 2) A GIS modeling based on an initial equation from Greg Holland, which was further modified to take into consideration the movement of the cyclones through time. 3) A Digital Elevation Model (SRTM). Unit is expected average number of event per 1000 years. This product was designed by UNEP/GRID-Europe for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: GIS processing UNEP/GRID-Europe.

Style.Name: cs_frequency_style
Style.Title: Raster
Style.Abstract: A sample style for rasters, good for displaying imagery

Layer.Name: preview:cs_physexp
Layer.Title: Cyclones surges physical exposure
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes an estimation of the annual physical exposition to surges from tropical cyclones of Saffir-Simpson category 1. It is based on four sources: 1) A compilation of best tracks dataset from WMO Regional Specialised Meteorological Centres (RSMCs) and Tropical Cyclone Warning Centres (TCWCs). As well as personal communication with Dr. Varigonda Subrahmanyam, Dr. James Weyman, Kiichi Sasaki, Philippe CAROFF, Jim Davidson, Simon Mc Gree, Steve Ready, Peter Kreft, Henrike Brecht. 2) A GIS modeling based on an initial equation from Greg Holland, which was further modified to take into consideration the movement of the cyclones through time. 3) A Digital Elevation Model (SRTM) at 90 m of resolution. 4) A population grid for the year 2007, provided by LandScanTM Global Population Database (Oak Ridge, TN: Oak Ridge National Laboratory). Unit is expected average annual population (2007 as the year of reference) exposed (inhabitants) . This product was designed by UNEP/GRID-Europe for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: GIS processing UNEP/GRID-Europe.

Style.Name: cs_physexp_style
Style.Title: Raster
Style.Abstract: A sample style for rasters, good for displaying imagery

Layer.Name: preview:cy_buffers
Layer.Title: Cyclones events
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes a compilation of estimated tropical cyclones windspeed (Saffir-Simpson categories) buffers 1975-2007. It is based on two sources: 1) A compilation of best tracks dataset from WMO Regional Specialised Meteorological Centres (RSMCs) and Tropical Cyclone Warning Centres (TCWCs). As well as personal communication with Dr. Varigonda Subrahmanyam, Dr. James Weyman, Kiichi Sasaki, Philippe CAROFF, Jim Davidson, Simon Mc Gree, Steve Ready, Peter Kreft, Henrike Brecht. 2) A GIS modeling based on an initial equation from Greg Holland, which was further modified to take into consideration the movement of the cyclones through time. This product was designed by UNEP/GRID-Europe for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: Compilation and GIS processing UNEP/GRID-Europe.

Style.Name: cy_buffers_style
Style.Title: Cyclones events
Style.Abstract: Cyclones events from 1975 to 2007

Layer.Name: preview:cy_ecoexp
Layer.Title: Cyclones economical exposure
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes an estimation of the annual economical exposition to tropical cyclones of Saffir-Simpson category 5. It is based on three sources: 1) A compilation of best tracks dataset from WMO Regional Specialised Meteorological Centres (RSMCs) and Tropical Cyclone Warning Centres (TCWCs). As well as personal communication with Dr. Varigonda Subrahmanyam, Dr. James Weyman, Kiichi Sasaki, Philippe CAROFF, Jim Davidson, Simon Mc Gree, Steve Ready, Peter Kreft, Henrike Brecht. 2) A GIS modeling based on an initial equation from Greg Holland, which was further modified to take into consideration the movement of the cyclones through time. 3) A Global Domestic Product grid for the year 2007, provided by the World Bank. Unit is expected average annual GDP (2007 as the year of reference) exposed in (US $, year 2000 equivalent) . This product was designed by UNEP/GRID-Europe for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: GIS processing UNEP/GRID-Europe.

Layer.Name: preview:cy_intensity
Layer.Title: Cyclones intensity
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes a footprint of estimated tropical cyclones windspeed (Saffir-Simpson categories) buffers 1975-2007. It is based on two sources: 1) A compilation of best tracks dataset from WMO Regional Specialised Meteorological Centres (RSMCs) and Tropical Cyclone Warning Centres (TCWCs). As well as personal communication with Dr. Varigonda Subrahmanyam, Dr. James Weyman, Kiichi Sasaki, Philippe CAROFF, Jim Davidson, Simon Mc Gree, Steve Ready, Peter Kreft, Henrike Brecht. 2) A GIS modeling based on an initial equation from Greg Holland, which was further modified to take into consideration the movement of the cyclones through time. Unit is estimated Saffir-Simpson categories. This product was designed by UNEP/GRID-Europe for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: Compilation and GIS processing UNEP/GRID-Europe.

Layer.Name: preview:cy_physexp
Layer.Title: Cyclones physical exposure
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes an estimation of the annual physical exposition to tropical cyclones of Saffir-Simpson category 5. It is based on three sources: 1) A compilation of best tracks dataset from WMO Regional Specialised Meteorological Centres (RSMCs) and Tropical Cyclone Warning Centres (TCWCs). As well as personal communication with Dr. Varigonda Subrahmanyam, Dr. James Weyman, Kiichi Sasaki, Philippe CAROFF, Jim Davidson, Simon Mc Gree, Steve Ready, Peter Kreft, Henrike Brecht. 2) A GIS modeling based on an initial equation from Greg Holland, which was further modified to take into consideration the movement of the cyclones through time. 3) A population grid for the year 2007, provided by LandScanTM Global Population Database (Oak Ridge, TN: Oak Ridge National Laboratory). Unit is expected average annual population (2007 as the year of reference) exposed (inhabitants) . This product was designed by UNEP/GRID-Europe for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: GIS processing UNEP/GRID-Europe.

Layer.Name: preview:cy_risk
Layer.Title: Cyclones risk
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes an estimate of the global risk induced by tropical cyclone hazard. Unit is estimated risk index from 1 (not null) to 10 (extreme). This product was designed by UNEP/GRID-Europe for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: UNEP/GRID-Europe.

Style.Name: cy_risk_style
Style.Title: Raster
Style.Abstract: A sample style for rasters, good for displaying imagery

Layer.Name: preview:cy_sumwinds
Layer.Title: Cyclones sum of winds
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes an estimated annual sum of tropical cyclones windspeed 1975-2007. It is based on two sources: 1) A compilation of best tracks dataset from WMO Regional Specialised Meteorological Centres (RSMCs) and Tropical Cyclone Warning Centres (TCWCs). As well as personal communication with Dr. Varigonda Subrahmanyam, Dr. James Weyman, Kiichi Sasaki, Philippe CAROFF, Jim Davidson, Simon Mc Gree, Steve Ready, Peter Kreft, Henrike Brecht. 2) A GIS modeling based on an initial equation from Greg Holland, which was further modified to take into consideration the movement of the cyclones through time. Unit is km/h x h. This product was designed by UNEP/GRID-Europe for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: Compilation and GIS processing UNEP/GRID-Europe.

Layer.Name: preview:cy_tracks
Layer.Title: Cyclones tracks
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes a compilation Tropical cyclones best tracks 1975-2007. It is based on two sources: 1) A compilation of best tracks dataset from WMO Regional Specialised Meteorological Centres (RSMCs) and Tropical Cyclone Warning Centres (TCWCs). As well as personal communication with Dr. Varigonda Subrahmanyam, Dr. James Weyman, Kiichi Sasaki, Philippe CAROFF, Jim Davidson, Simon Mc Gree, Steve Ready, Peter Kreft, Henrike Brecht. 2) A GIS modeling based on an initial equation from Greg Holland, which was further modified to take into consideration the movement of the cyclones through time This product was designed by UNEP/GRID-Europe for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: Compilation and GIS processing UNEP/GRID-Europe.

Style.Name: cy_tracks
Style.Title: Cyclones tracks
Style.Abstract: Cyclones events from 1975 to 2007

Layer.Name: preview:dr_cv
Layer.Title: Droughts frequency (Coefficient of variation)
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes an estimate of the Coefficient of variation. It is based on two sources: 1) A global monthly gridded precipitation dataset obtained from the Global Precipitation Climatology Center (GPCC). 2) A GIS modeling of global Standardized Precipitation Index based on Mckee et al. (1993) methodology. Unit is CV index multiplied x 100. This product was designed by IRI and CIESIN (Columbia University) for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: IRI and CIESIN (Columbia University).

Style.Name: dr_cv_style
Style.Title: Raster
Style.Abstract: A sample style for rasters, good for displaying imagery

Layer.Name: preview:dr_ecoexp
Layer.Title: Droughts economical exposure
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes an estimate of global drought annual repartition based on Standardized Precipitation Index. It is based on three sources: 1) A global monthly gridded precipitation dataset obtained from the Climatic Research Unit (University of East Anglia). 2) A GIS modeling of global Standardized Precipitation Index based on Brad Lyon (IRI, Columbia University) methodology. 3) A Global Domestic Product grid for the year 2007, provided by the World Bank. Unit is expected average annual GDP (2007 as the year of reference) exposed in (US $, year 2000 equivalent) . This product was designed by UNEP/GRID-Europe for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: GIS processing UNEP/GRID-Europe.

Style.Name: dr_ecoexp_style
Style.Title: Raster
Style.Abstract: A sample style for rasters, good for displaying imagery

Layer.Name: preview:dr_events
Layer.Title: Droughts events
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes an estimate of global drought annual repartition based on Standardized Precipitation Index. It is based on two sources: 1) A global monthly gridded precipitation dataset obtained from the Climatic Research Unit (University of East Anglia). 2) A GIS modeling of global Standardized Precipitation Index based on Brad Lyon (IRI, Columbia University) methodology. This product was designed by UNEP/GRID-Europe for the Project of Risk Evaluation, Vulnerability, Information & Early Warning (PreView). It was modeled using global data. Credit: UNEP/GRID-Europe.

Style.Name: dr_events_style
Style.Title: Droughts events
Style.Abstract: Droughts events from 1997 to 2007

Layer.Name: preview:dr_physexp
Layer.Title: Droughts physical exposure
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes an estimate of global drought annual repartition based on Standardized Precipitation Index. It is based on three sources: 1) A global monthly gridded precipitation dataset obtained from the Climatic Research Unit (University of East Anglia). 2) A GIS modeling of global Standardized Precipitation Index based on Brad Lyon (IRI, Columbia University) methodology. 3) A population grid for the year 2007, provided by LandScanTM Global Population Database (Oak Ridge, TN: Oak Ridge National Laboratory). Unit is expected average annual population (2007 as the year of reference) exposed (inhabitants) . This product was designed by UNEP/GRID-Europe for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: GIS processing UNEP/GRID-Europe.

Layer.Name: preview:eq_ecoexp
Layer.Title: Earthquakes economical exposure
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes an estimate the annual economical exposition to earthquakes of MMI categories higher than 9 over the period 1973-2007. It is based on two data sources: 1) Modified Mercalli Intensity map available in the Shakemap Atlas from USGS. 2) A Global Domestic Product grid for the year 2007, provided by the World Bank. Unit is expected average annual GDP (2007 as the year of reference) exposed in (US $, year 2000 equivalent) . This product was compiled by UNEP/GRID-Europe for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: GIS processing Shakemap Atlas from USGS, compilation and global hazard distribution UNEP/GRID-Europe.

Style.Name: eq_ecoexp_style
Style.Title: Raster
Style.Abstract: A sample style for rasters, good for displaying imagery

Layer.Name: preview:eq_frequency
Layer.Title: Earthquakes MMI
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes an estimate of earthquake frequency of MMI categories higher than 9 over the period 1973-2007. It is based on Modified Mercalli Intensity map available in the Shakemap Atlas from USGS. Unit is expected average number of events per 1000 years. This product was compiled by UNEP/GRID-Europe for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: GIS processing Shakemap Atlas from USGS, compilation and global hazard distribution UNEP/GRID-Europe.

Style.Name: eq_frequency_style
Style.Title: Raster
Style.Abstract: A sample style for rasters, good for displaying imagery

Layer.Name: preview:eq_frequency3
Layer.Title: Earthquakes frequency
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes an estimate of earthquake frequency of MMI categories higher than 9 over the period 1973-2007. It is based on Modified Mercalli Intensity map available in the Shakemap Atlas from USGS. Unit is expected average number of events per 1000 years. This product was compiled by UNEP/GRID-Europe for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: GIS processing Shakemap Atlas from USGS, compilation and global hazard distribution UNEP/GRID-Europe.

Layer.Name: preview:eq_intensity
Layer.Title: Earthquakes intensity
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes an estimate of the footprint of earthquake Modified Mercalli Intensity Shakemaps over the period 1973-2007. It is based on Modified Mercalli Intensity map available in the Shakemap Atlas from USGS. Unit is simulated Modified Mercalli Index categories used within the GAR project. This product was compiled by UNEP/GRID-Europe for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR), from the Shakemap Atlas (USGS). It was modeled using global data. Credit: GIS processing Shakemap Atlas from USGS, compilation and global hazard distribution UNEP/GRID-Europe.

Style.Name: eq_intensity_style
Style.Title: Raster
Style.Abstract: A sample style for rasters, good for displaying imagery

Layer.Name: preview:eq_physexp
Layer.Title: Earthquakes physical exposure
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes an estimate the annual physical exposition to earthquake frequency of MMI categories higher than 9 over the period 1973-2007. It is based on two data sources: 1) Modified Mercalli Intensity map available in the Shakemap Atlas from USGS. 2) A population grid for the year 2007, provided by LandScanTM Global Population Database (Oak Ridge, TN: Oak Ridge National Laboratory). Unit is expected average annual population (2007 as the year of reference) exposed (inhabitants) . This product was compiled by UNEP/GRID-Europe for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: GIS processing Shakemap Atlas from USGS, compilation and global hazard distribution UNEP/GRID-Europe.

Style.Name: eq_physexp_style
Style.Title: Raster
Style.Abstract: A sample style for rasters, good for displaying imagery

Layer.Name: preview:fi_average
Layer.Title: Fires density
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes an estimate of fires density over the period 1997-2008. It is based on the modified algorithm 1 product of World Fire atlas (WFA, ESA-ESRIN) dataset. UNEP/GRID-Europe compiled the monthly data and processed the global fire density. Unit is expected average number of event per 0.1 decimal degree pixel per year. This product was designed by UNEP/GRID-Europe for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: GIS processing World Fire atlas (ESA-ESRIN), Fire density UNEP/GRID-Europe.

Style.Name: fi_average_style
Style.Title: Raster
Style.Abstract: A sample style for rasters, good for displaying imagery

Layer.Name: preview:fl_ecoexp
Layer.Title: Floods economical exposure
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes an estimate of the annual economical exposition to flood. It is based on four sources: 1) A GIS modeling using a statistical estimation of peak-flow magnitude and a hydrological model using HydroSHEDS dataset and the Manning equation to estimate river stage for the calculated discharge value. 2) Observed flood from 1999 to 2007, obtained from the Dartmouth Flood Observatory (DFO). 3) The frequency was set using the frequency from UNEP/GRID-Europe PREVIEW flood dataset. In area where no information was available, it was set to 50 years returning period. 4) A Global Domestic Product grid for the year 2007, provided by the World Bank. Unit is expected average annual GDP (2007 as the year of reference) exposed in (US $, year 2000 equivalent) . This product was designed by UNEP/GRID-Europe for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: GIS processing UNEP/GRID-Europe, with key support from USGS EROS Data Center, Dartmouth Flood Observatory 2008.

Style.Name: fl_ecoexp_style
Style.Title: Raster
Style.Abstract: A sample style for rasters, good for displaying imagery

Layer.Name: preview:fl_frequency
Layer.Title: Floods frequency
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes an estimate of flood frequency. It is based on three sources: 1) A GIS modeling using a statistical estimation of peak-flow magnitude and a hydrological model using HydroSHEDS dataset and the Manning equation to estimate river stage for the calculated discharge value. 2) Observed flood from 1999 to 2007, obtained from the Dartmouth Flood Observatory (DFO). 3) The frequency was set using the frequency from UNEP/GRID-Europe PREVIEW flood dataset. In area where no information was available, it was set to 50 years returning period. Unit is expected average number of event per 100 years. This product was designed by UNEP/GRID-Europe for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: GIS processing UNEP/GRID-Europe, with key support from USGS EROS Data Center, Dartmouth Flood Observatory 2008.

Style.Title: Raster
Style.Abstract: A sample style for rasters, good for displaying imagery

It is based on four sources: 1) A GIS modeling using a statistical estimation of peak-flow magnitude and a hydrological model using HydroSHEDS dataset and the Manning equation to estimate river stage for the calculated discharge value. 2) Observed flood from 1999 to 2007, obtained from the Dartmouth Flood Observatory (DFO). 3) The frequency was set using the frequency from UNEP/GRID-Europe PREVIEW flood dataset. In area where no information was available, it was set to 50 years returning period. 4) A population grid for the year 2007, provided by LandScanTM Global Population Database (Oak Ridge, TN: Oak Ridge National Laboratory). Unit is expected average annual population (2007 as the year of reference) exposed (inhabitants) . This product was designed by UNEP/GRID-Europe for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: GIS processing UNEP/GRID-Europe, with key support from USGS EROS Data Center, Dartmouth Flood Observatory 2008.

Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes an estimate of the global risk induced by flood hazard. Unit is estimated risk index from 1 (not null) to 10 (extreme). This product was designed by UNEP/GRID-Europe for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: UNEP/GRID-Europe.

Layer.Name: preview:ls_ecoexp
Layer.Title: Landslides earthquakes economical exposure
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes an estimate of the annual economical exposition of landslide triggered by earthquakes. It depends on the combination of trigger and susceptibility defined by six parameters: slope factor, lithological (or geological) conditions, soil moisture condition, vegetation cover, precipitation and seismic conditions. A Global Domestic Product grid for the year 2007, provided by the World Bank, has also been used. Unit is expected average annual GDP (2007 as the year of reference) exposed in (US $, year 2000 equivalent). This product was designed by International Centre for Geohazards /NGI for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: GIS processing International Centre for Geohazards /NGI.

Style.Name: ls_ecoexp_style
Style.Title: Raster
Style.Abstract: A sample style for rasters, good for displaying imagery

Layer.Name: preview:ls_eq
Layer.Title: Landslides earthquakes frequency
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes an estimate of the annual frequency of landslide triggered by earthquakes. It depends on the combination of trigger and susceptibility defined by six parameters: slope factor, lithological (or geological) conditions, soil moisture condition, vegetation cover, precipitation and seismic conditions. Unit is expected annual probability and percentage of pixel of occurrence of a potentially destructive landslide event x 1000000. This product was designed by International Centre for Geohazards /NGI for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: GIS processing International Centre for Geohazards /NGI.

Style.Name: ls_risk_style
Style.Title: Raster
Style.Abstract: A sample style for rasters, good for displaying imagery

Layer.Name: preview:ml_risk
Layer.Title: Multiple risk
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes an estimate of the global risk induced by multiple hazards (tropical cyclone, earthquake, flood and landslide induced by precipitations). Unit is estimated risk index from 1 (not null) to 10 (extreme). This product was designed by UNEP/GRID-Europe for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: UNEP/GRID-Europe.

Style.Name: ml_risk_style
Style.Title: Raster
Style.Abstract: A sample style for rasters, good for displaying imagery

Layer.Name: preview:ts_ecoexp
Layer.Title: Tsunamis economical exposure
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes an estimation of the annual economical exposition to tsunamis. It is based on three sources: 1) A comprehensive list of reports and scientific papers compiled and utilized in producing tsunami hazard maps as well as finding return periods of future events. 2) Applying numerical tsunami models and zooming on selected areas. 3) A Global Domestic Product grid for the year 2007, provided by the World Bank. Unit is expected average annual GDP (2007 as the year of reference) exposed in (US $, year 2000 equivalent) . This product was designed by International Centre for Geohazards /NGI for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: GIS processing International Centre for Geohazards /NGI.

Style.Name: ts_ecoexp_style
Style.Title: Raster
Style.Abstract: A sample style for rasters, good for displaying imagery

Layer.Name: preview:ts_frequency
Layer.Title: Tsunamis frequency
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes an estimate of tsunami frequency. It is based on two sources: 1) A comprehensive list of reports and scientific papers compiled and utilized in producing tsunami hazard maps as well as finding return periods of future events. 2) Applying numerical tsunami models and zooming on selected areas. Unit is expected affected percentage of each pixel over a minimum return period of 500 years. This product was designed by International Centre for Geohazards /NGI for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: GIS processing International Centre for Geohazards /NGI.

Style.Name: ts_frequency_style
Style.Title: Raster
Style.Abstract: A sample style for rasters, good for displaying imagery

Layer.Name: preview:ts_physexp
Layer.Title: Tsunamis physical exposure
Layer.Abstract: This dataset includes an estimation of the annual physical exposition to tsunamis. It is based on three sources: 1) A comprehensive list of reports and scientific papers compiled and utilized in producing tsunami hazard maps as well as finding return periods of future events. 2) Applying numerical tsunami models and zooming on selected areas. 3) A population grid for the year 2007, provided by LandScanTM Global Population Database (Oak Ridge, TN: Oak Ridge National Laboratory). Unit is expected average annual population (2007 as the year of reference) exposed (inhabitants) . This product was designed by International Centre for Geohazards /NGI for the Global Assessment Report on Risk Reduction (GAR). It was modeled using global data. Credit: GIS processing International Centre for Geohazards /NGI.

Style.Name: ts_physexp_style
Style.Title: Raster
Style.Abstract: A sample style for rasters, good for displaying imagery
